Sentencas: The properties of BaO-CaO-Al2O3-SiO2 (BCAS) glass seal materials reinforced with 5-30 wt.% glass fiber are investigated.
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The seals are prepared by solid mixing process.
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The microstruc-ture and phase content of the samples are studied.
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Mechanical properties are investigated by Vickers micro-hardness, nano-indentation and compression tests.
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The thermal prop-erties of the samples are evaluated by conducting a dilatometry analysis.
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity and leak resistance of the seal materials are measured at high temperatures.
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Increasing the amount of glass fiber in the composite samples decreases the magnitude of the thermal expansion coefficient.
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is found the addition of just 5 wt.% of glass fiber (GF5sample) increases the indentation fracture toughness of the seals by & SIM;280% without impairing other properties.
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: It is also found that the GF5 sample has high electrical resistiv-ity with the activation energy of 63.7 kJ/mol and very low leak rate of 1.7 x 10-4 sccm/cm at 750 degrees C.& COPY; 2022 The Author(s).
Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Titulo: Characterization of a barium-calcium-aluminosilicate glass/fiber glass composite seal for intermediate temperature solid oxide fuel cells
